page.description: CURL is a popular utility that can be used for many tasks, such as making REST API calls.

section.description: CRUL is now exposed as a top level Xbasic object, allowing you to execute CURL commands from your Xbasic code. Many APIs are documented using CURL examples. You can use a built-in genie to convert a CURL command into an Xbasic script. To get to the CURL genie, right click on white space in the Xbasic code editor and select the 'Genies...' command. The select the 'CURL command to Xbasic....' command.
This opens the CURL to Xbasic Genie where you can type in a CURL command then then click the 'Generate Xbasic' button to generate the Xbasic code to execute the specified CURL command.
For more information on the Xbasic CURL object, click here.
